title: Infinite families of triangle presentations
abstract:
A triangle presentation is a combinatorial datum that encodes the action of a
group on a $2$-dimensional triangle complex with prescribed links, which is
simply transitive on the vertices. We provide the first infinite family of
triangle presentations that give rise to lattices in exotic buildings of type
$\widetilde{\text{A}_2}$ of arbitrarily large order. Our method also gives rise
to infinite families of triangle presentations for other link types, such as
opposition complexes in Desarguesian projective planes.
